Ok, changed the code to always truncate the string if over 3 chars or pad if under. Regarding verifying that they are all digits, the regex already rejects the fraction if it's not all digits (and returns null).

Thanks @takidau @XuMingmin

But really Apache Commons has the same status as Guava as "the standard library that you are going to reimplement anyhow" so unless we can replace it with ~zero lines of utility code I'm not so sure about ditching it. Another example is https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/util/StringUtils.java#L37

But we can fix the build and revisit later, so I'm going to merge if postcommit is g2g.
run java postcommit

CC @jbonofre the `pom.xml` at HEAD has `commons-lang3` as a `provided` dependency. So that is overriding the straightforward main dependency from `commons-text` to `commons-lang3` I think. I cannot recall why changing that from `provided` to `test` did not work, or whether there were other problems going on.
run java postcommit

@takidau I change the definition of `BeamSqlUdaf` to `BeamSqlUdaf<InputT, AccumT, OutputT>`, to get rid of `BeamSqlRow`. Can you have a review? Let's finish this before your vocation.

@xumingming do you want to have a peak again as it's a little big change?
No more necessary as `commons-text`is no more used.
Can you rebase and fix the conflict in order to do a new Jenkins run ? Thanks !

R: @XuMingmin @takidau

About "how to tell whether a table is bounded or unbounded", my current thinking is using the location scheme, e.g. `hbase-bounded` means a bounded hbase table, while `hbase-unbounded` means a unbounded hbase table, it should work, but not beautiful, looking for suggestions for this one.
Huh, I wish there was something like this in Guava https://github.com/google/guava/issues/2113
Well, on the other hand Commons is a more stable library so we could use it without shading.
+R @JingsongLi or @jkff

Am I right that we still have no test coverage for the merge methods in the accumulators? If so, what's the plan for getting test coverage there?

Other than that, this PR LGTM.

If my git skills are in place, then this LGTM and I'll merge it. Specifically, there's no output from `git log --no-merges github/pr/3479 ^github/master ^github/gearpump-runner` so that means no fixup was needed.
I see the `runnable-on-service-tests` (should rename that execution so it is easier to find) and it looks like it passed with the new snapshot version. Great!

I guess it's only called with a distributed environment, and TestPipeline is not. I could add some tests directly for the built-in aggregators. 

Sent from my iPhone

That's okay, let's call this good enough for now. LGTM, I'll go ahead and merge. However, can you please:

1. File a Jira to make sure we add tests exercising merge for accumulators
2. Follow up with @tgroh to find out how we can exercise merge methods in combiners in a SQL DSL test?

Thank you!
Merged.
